intro: Oxymyrrhine plicata, commonly known as the crested bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, cylindrical inflorescences that resemble bottle brushes. The plant features bright red or orange flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical spikes. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of wax. Oxymyrrhine plicata is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments.
